children.text: I want to start by stating that this essay is not for everyone.  I think there might very well be people out there whose circumstance really do force their hand, and there are things they have to do.  And there are jobs where the consequence of on individual in action can have life and death effects.  But chances are this is not you.  And that means you
So I want to propose that if we
have to do anything, we should stop saying that we have to.  I want to offer a two-step process to move away from "have to."
Let's start with a few examples where one might use "have to" language:
